aws::graph::propositions: # Meteorological Information and Flight Plan for Accident Near San Antonio International Airport
The accident site had Visual Meteorological Conditions (VMC).
The condition of light at the accident site was Day.
The observation facility was San Antonio International Airport (KSAT).
KSAT is at an elevation of 789 feet mean sea level.
KSAT is 1 Nautical Mile from the accident site.
The observation time was 12:51 Local.
KSAT is 328° from the accident site.
The lowest cloud condition was Few clouds at 1700 feet Above Ground Level.
Visibility at the accident site was 10 miles.
The wind speed was 5 knots.
No wind gusts were reported.
The wind direction was 180°.
No actual turbulence was reported.
No turbulence severity was reported.
The altimeter setting was 30.02 inches of mercury.
The temperature was 26°C.
The dew point was 22°C.
There was no obscuration at the accident site.
There was no precipitation at the accident site.
The departure point was San Antonio, TX (SAT).
The flight plan filed was Instrument Flight Rules (IFR).
The destination was Phoenix, AZ (PHX).
The clearance type was Instrument Flight Rules (IFR).
The airspace type was Class C.

text:
# Meteorological Information and Flight Plan

## Conditions at Accident Site:
- Visual (VMC)
- Condition of Light: Day

## Observation Facility, Elevation:
- KSAT,789 ft msl
- Distance from Accident Site: 1 Nautical Miles

## Observation Time:
- 12:51 Local
- Direction from Accident Site: 328°

## Lowest Cloud Condition:
- Few / 1700 ft AGL
- Visibility: 10 miles

## Lowest Ceiling:
- Visibility (RVR):

## Wind Speed/Gusts:
- 5 knots /
- Turbulence Type Forecast/Actual: / None

## Wind Direction:
- 180°
- Turbulence Severity Forecast/Actual: / N/A

## Altimeter Setting:
- 30.02 inches Hg
- Temperature/Dew Point: 26°C / 22°C

## Precipitation and Obscuration:
- No Obscuration; No Precipitation

## Departure Point:
- San Antonio, TX (SAT )
- Type of Flight Plan Filed: IFR

## Destination:
- PHOENIX, AZ (PHX )
- Type of Clearance: IFR

## Departure Time:
- Type of Airspace: Class C
